intro: Banisteria, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often resemble butterflies, hence its common name. Banisteria species typically have woody stems and produce small, elliptical leaves. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant and unique floral displays.
